content: *the idea behind this jacket creating two hexagons with 90˚ angles and sewing them together has been around for a while but i decided to create my own pattern for it materials 400 yards of worsted weight yarn size i/9 5 5mm hook if you would like to do any of the options cuffs lengthen the jacket you will need more yarn this pattern can be done in any weight yarn since the number of rounds determines the jacket s size rather than the gauge the yarn pictured is cotton supreme batik by universal yarns 180 yards / 100 grams / 100% cotton gauge 4 stitches and 2 row to 1 square gauge is not terribly important in this pattern especially if you decide to do it with a different weight yarn and a different hook i crocheted each hexagon so that the circumference of the jacket would be approximately 19 appropriate for a 3-6 month old baby please keep in mind that baby sizes vary so you may want to measure the baby before you begin stitches used slip_stitch slip_stitch double_crochet double_crochet single_crochet single_crochet chain chain other abbreviations stitch st space space make two *charts for certain aspects of the pattern are located after the written instructions also the last two pages contain pictures which are referenced throughout the pattern use the magic_ring method to create the loop to crochet into or chain 4 and join with slip_stitch round 1 chain 3 counts as 1rst double_crochet here and throughout pattern 2 double_crochet in circle chain 2 *3 double_crochet chain 2 repeat from * five times six sets of 3 double_crochet slip_stitch into top of beginning ch3 to join see picture pull tail of the yarn to tighten up the circle if you used the magic loop method round 2 chain 3 double_crochet into same st picture double_crochet in each double_crochet times double_crochet in each double_crochet until the beginning ch3 at the start of the round slip_stitch into top of beginning ch3 to join you should have six sets of 7 double_crochet see charts and
